author: Derek Main
message: Going on Myeni's testimony JZ's Foundation is just as corrupt as the Clinton Foundation @Margareth Waterboer Yes - there were rumours that they were/are lovers. Doesn't bring a pretty picture to mind. @Elvis Malakoane Yes - that is the bottleneck at the moment. And the criminals keep on plundering in the meanwhile. @Mbuso Ndlovu You seem to have a real beef with the chair and the commission - care to explain? @Mbuso Ndlovu Of course we are - just trying to understand where you're coming from. Would you be critical no matter what? multi @Diss & Dad I think it should continue indefinitely - until all the criminals are behind bars. Exposes corruption and acts as deterrent. @Diss & Dad I don't think he has yet but I think he should be given one. @Diss & Dad I would like to see a permanent forum where the criminals can be grilled and shamed on national tv. Hopefully that'll put them off. @Diss & Dad I'm not sure but I put my faith in Zondo. Perhaps the format could be relooked at for a more permanent ""live"" court?" @Diss & Dad I reckon he has assistance to manage it all. I'm sure he sits down after each session and organises the info. A mammoth task but not impossible. "@Diss & Dad If Zondo wasn't managing "@Diss & Dad Thought you said you were East German? What's with the ""our indigenous people""?" @Diss & Dad You never mentioned before that you're east german. You said you were in Germany but not that you originated from there. @Fana Nkosi Spot on. "@Diss & Dad I agree - Malema does raise relevant issues that resonate with a large amount of SAfns. If only he didn't always couch his comments in race politics

author: Dominic Przybylski
message: Miss Hofmeyer was almost in tears when she asked for remote testimony. I like interpreters hairstyle. No way Mr X is anonymous anymore. "@Gareth Hellyar No @Gareth Hellyar and those people will make sure everybody else does. I've just seen latest BEE proposal for ICT companies. If they don't give 30% of their company to black owners they can be fined up to R5million or get jail sentence of up to 2 years. Information Communication Technology - ie. software. @Diss & Dad My father came from Poland after 2nd world war and his family home was expropriated without compensation by communist government. I was born in SA. @Diss & Dad It seems that expropriation without compensation runs in my family. "@Diss & Dad There was no apartheid when my father came to SA and yes "@Diss & Dad Yes @Diss & Dad My father was always against racial discrimination and had many altercations with the police about the existing laws. @Diss & Dad Easy to blame people from a distance which allows you to claim shades of grey as black and white. @Diss & Dad Nats were against everybody who was not Afrikaans. It was many years before a non-Afrikaaner was allowed to play rugby as a Springbok. Tommy Bedford was famous for being the 1st. @Diss & Dad That was the impression of most white South Africans who were not Afrikaans. "@Diss & Dad When I was conscripted was the first time I met Afrikaaners and when I confronted them about apaartheid "@Diss & Dad They had never been exposed to an alternative perspective "@Diss & Dad I've been here then and now @Diss & Dad Compare Julius Malema to Eugene Terreblanche. The similarities are striking. @Diss & Dad When did you last visit South Africa? @Diss & Dad Eugene Terreblanche wasn't a government official either. @Diss & Dad both had racial/fascist approaches. @Diss & Dad Both approach the problem from race. I prefer not to base an argument on race because then it is simply a case of reaching a conclusion based on melamin. @Diss & Dad I'm not into identiy politics. I'm an individual. @Diss & Dad We aren't going to get anywhere in this discussion. Let's concentrate on the inquiry.
